instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Hi guys, 

Got another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board with this measurements: 


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 1,4 V seems to be shorted to ground but cant find where.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 1,4V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 1.4V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 17V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> -3.42V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>- 3.45V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 0 V ( not shorted to ground)

Is it possible that all that is shorted to ground through CPU?



CPU is getting warm, even hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Not really short, as you get 1.4V.
But could have low resistance to ground; post exact value, diode mode and ohm mode too.

"CPU is getting warm, even hot."
This points to shorted high-side MOSFET from CPU power supply.
If you get close to 000 resistance between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and CPU coils, remove and check outside <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>/20/30/50/60 (one by one).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
PPBUS in diode mode 0.004 and resistance 3.3Ohms


CPU coils u mean L7520/10/50 i guess. If so i get about 4-5 ohms between coils and ppbus-g3h

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
What exact resistance to ground on the CPU coils?
Any other big coil has 004 (apart of CPU)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
L7550/10/20 to ground is 1,8ohms. and 0.002 in diode mode. 

Other big coils (diode mode): 

L7100 - 0.004 
L7630 -0.008

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Exact resistance between L7100 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
If close to 000, then <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> is shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Yes. I was getting 0.5 between L7100 and PPBUS. So i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> and now getting 7 ohms ( still not turned on the board). IS that what i have to get? I checked resistance between theese two point on other board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) and getting over 3Khoms, But thats not working board so i cant take it as right one.


P.S: Pbus now is 2.6V but still seems to be shorted to ground. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> getting hot, changed it, now ppbus 3V but <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> still getting hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
STOP to power a board where you clearly see a short!!!

Check resistance between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all big coils.
Remove F7040 and post voltage and resistance to ground at L7030.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: Now i have another problem. No green light. Just put it in ultrasonic to clean all flux. Checked and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> is 33 ohms instead of 470Khoms. When remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> the value becames right. When put new <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> again 33ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> now <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> is ok, 470 kOhms. Still no green light. 

Checked <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81/85/86 all is ok but seems that magsafe is blocked. ISL ohms between 17/18 and 27/28 are ok (20/4 Ohms)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: Do you get 3V42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46724"]Do you get 3V42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?[/QUOTE]

No, 

all rails are 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Is F6905 OK?
Do you have voltage on it?
DCIN voltage pin 2/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
Did you properly solder <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>?
Check the same voltages using fake charger, or bench power supply...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46728"]Is F6905 OK?
Do you have voltage on it?
DCIN voltage pin 2/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
Did you properly solder <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>?
Check the same voltages using fake charger, or bench power supply...[/QUOTE]

F6905 is ok. No voltage on it. DCIN pin 2 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 0V. With fake magsafe ( i dont have so i injected by power supplu) injected voltage on pin 2 and F6905 let pass voltage through. 


<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> is soldered good. 

I am stucked at this point. Seems to be current protection but cant find what is wrong

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Original charger detects leakage and stops to power the board.

Post some voltages around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> with bench power supply.
Check if <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/11 both OK.
Also check for short to ground at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins.

Post exact value (ohm scale, measured onboard) for <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post visible few cm above; maintain the forum aesthetic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:

Pins:

1/2 - 4.2V
3 - 1.06V
4- 3,4 V
5 - 0 V
6 - 3,4V
7/8 - 0V
9 - 0.5V
10/11/12/13 - 3.4V
14/15/16 - 0V
17/18 -1.4V
19/20 - 4.4V
21 - 0V
23/24 -1.4V
25 - 4.4V
26/27/28 2,4V


I'm injecting 16V. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is getting very hot.


<RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> 3 9Khoms <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> 30Khoms so they are ok. 

<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> -62K <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> - 99,5K <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> - 317K

And <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> - 77Ohms Removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> And it's now 470 as must be. Changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> by new one. Now <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> is ok. Guess it was broken while injecting.


P.S. COnected magsafe and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> again 77ohms so <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> must be fucked again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
"I'm injecting 16V. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is getting very hot."
Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> at same time.

Why did you inject 16V, and where???

threads.message: You asked me to post voltage near <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. As i said before that there is no voltage with magsafe and i dont have false magsafe the only way is injecting:) Right?

threads.message:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: thanks, will try it tomorrow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
Sorry for delay. Changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Now <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> is 740kOhms but still no green light and all rails are missing. Magsafe is getting blocked by MLB. 


Well. Checked and it was <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> in short. No get magsafe light, PPBUS 1.9V but shorted to ground. F7040 PIN2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: Your CPU has been dead from the start lol. It should not get hot on a direct short to ground unless it or a high side fet are shorter

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message:
If you get 1.9V, is not shorted.
Probably one high-side MOSFET shorts <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to a coil of a secondary power supply.
Post exact ohm value for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all big coils.
If problem is on CPU VCORE, you can have dead board now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus low, not turning on
threads.message: Finally sent back logic board to my customer. Too many hours with it. Thanks you all:)
